task.title: Change the Properties of Layout Viewports
task.shortdesc: Like common objects, layout viewports are characterized by object properties such as layer, color, linetype, linetype scale and lineweight. Which are all displayed and changed on properties palette.

context.p: Viewports are created on the current layer so as to control the visibility of the boundaries. The user can freeze or set plot configurations for layers in Layer Property Manager to avoid plotting the viewport. The visibility of the boundary is non-associative to the viewport if they are located in different layers.

step.cmd: Clickthe border of the layout viewport whose properties you want to modify.
Open the Properties palette through the menu option "Tools > Properties" or "Modify > Properties".
In the Properties palette, select Standard Scale, and then select a new scale from

result.p: the list. The scale you choose is applied to the viewport.
NOTE You can select only layout viewports for modification. If you click a viewport on the Model tab, it makes that viewport active, not available for modification.
